Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a lead-flipping sixth-inning grand slam in the 2024 NLCS game, securing a 4-1 win for the Mets over the Phillies.
Post-Match Reflections: David Stearns, the Mets' president of baseball operations, expressed amazement at Lindor's historic hit, calling it 'absolutely crazy.'
Players and staff in the Mets' clubhouse reacted with pure joy and disbelief, comparing the moment to living as fans rather than observers.
Jesse Winker praised Lindor as the MVP, stating, 'He’s carried us all year. It’s like every time there’s a big home run, he hits it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The slam was the first lead-flipping postseason slam in Mets franchise history.
Only two other men in MLB history have hit a lead-flipping slam in the sixth inning or later in a series-clinching game: Shane Victorino in 2013 and Devon White in 1997.
